name: plethora
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with: There's a plethora of books about the royal family. The plethora of regulations is both contradictory and confusing. Synonym
profusion formalCompare
cornucopia formal
an embarrassment of riches formal
